intro: Macrostylis ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed macrostylis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically green and smooth on the upper surface. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, a common feature in the Araceae family. Macrostylis ovata is often found in wetlands and marshy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
